title: Ticket #5657: Master failed to restart after upgrade to 8.5.5-366162
description:

remarks:
2016-May-05 11:30:47 by tim:
errno 122 is "Disk quota exceeded"

2016-May-05 11:38:15 by moate:
Submit-4's spool is indeed in /home, which has quotas. The condor quota was below the soft limit, but I don't really trust quotas, and the spool could have been larger when the issue occurred. So, I think this was due to misconfiguration and not a HTCondor bug. Recommend closing the ticket.

-Moate

2016-May-05 12:13:34 by tannenba:
The problem is the condor_master tried to create a new linux kernel session key, and this operation failed because there is a quota on the number of such keys each UID is allowed to create.

In this incident, the master failed to start because uid 0 (root) had exhausted its key quota. See http://linux.die.net/man/3/keyctl_join_session_keyring

The problem is submit-4, for some reason, user root on submit-4 has a very small quota (just 200 keys!), compared to say submit-5 (which has 1M keys) and the CSL-managed ingwe.cs (also 1M keys).

Why submit-4 and submit-5 have different kernel limits set is anyone's guess.

Behold : 

[tannenba@submit-4 ~]$ cat /proc/sys/kernel/keys/root_maxkeys
200
[tannenba@submit-4 ~]$ cat /proc/sys/kernel/keys/root_maxbytes
20000

[tannenba@submit-5 ~]$ cat /proc/sys/kernel/keys/root_maxkeys
1000000
[tannenba@submit-5 ~]$ cat /proc/sys/kernel/keys/root_maxbytes
25000000

ingwe.cs.wisc.edu{tannenba}54: cat /proc/sys/kernel/keys/root_maxkeys
1000000
ingwe.cs.wisc.edu{tannenba}55: cat /proc/sys/kernel/keys/root_maxbytes
25000000

Looks like submit-4 is currently running with 199 of its allowable 200 keys in use!! Also it is using almost a third of its key bytes quota... behold: 

[tannenba@submit-4 ~]$ cat /proc/key-users | head -1
    0:   204 203/203 199/200 5867/20000

BTW, the fields for /proc/key-users is (from http://is.gd/mXp2M3 ) 

<UID>                     User ID
<usage>                 Usage count
<inst>/<keys>      Total number of keys and number instantiated
<keys>/<max>     Key count quota
<bytes><max>     Key size quota

I strongly suggest submit-4 have the same amount of root_maxkeys and root_maxbytes as apparently all other RHEL6 machine have...

Another idea would be for HTCondor kernel tuning script to set these.
